result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Scott Farberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with any sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: $528 costs--DOC collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.
Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with any sentence now serving.

in support of Petition
May 13, 2016--Plea/Sentencing

Defendant Kevin Scott Farberg in court in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Mark Matthew Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea to count 1, Court finds defendant guilty.  PSI WAIVED.  Court orders 2 years WSP and 3 years extended supervision, concurrent with any sentence now serving; 286 days sentence credit; AODA; DOC collect $528 costs; eligible for SAP, ineligible for CIP.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Parties may file motion re: sentence credit within 45 days.

Dodge Correctional Institution
